description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. A-Frame has an asset management system that allows us to place our assets (images, audio, video, 3d models) in one place and to preload and cache assets for better performance.
description.text: A-Frame has an asset management system that allows us to place our assets (images, audio, video, 3d models) in one place and to preload and cache assets for better performance.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. It's used to load assets (external files used in the scene) like 3D objects
description.text: It's used to load assets (external files used in the scene) like 3D objects

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The box primitive creates shapes such as boxes, cubes, or walls.
description.text: The box primitive creates shapes such as boxes, cubes, or walls.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. It determines what the user sees. We can change the viewport by modifying the camera entity's position and rotation.
description.text: It determines what the user sees. We can change the viewport by modifying the camera entity's position and rotation.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The circle primitive creates circles surfaces using the geometry component with the type set to circle.
description.text: The circle primitive creates circles surfaces using the geometry component with the type set to circle.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The cone primitive creates a cone shape.
description.text: The cone primitive creates a cone shape.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. This creates an environment map from six images put together to form a cube. The cubemap wraps around the mesh and applied as a texture.
description.text: This creates an environment map from six images put together to form a cube. The cubemap wraps around the mesh and applied as a texture.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The cursor primitive is a reticle that allows for clicking and basic interactivity with a scene on devices that do not have a hand controller. The default appearance is a ring geometry. The cursor is usually placed as a child of the camera.
description.text: The cursor primitive is a reticle that allows for clicking and basic interactivity with a scene on devices that do not have a hand controller. The default appearance is a ring geometry. The cursor is usually placed as a child of the camera.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The curved image primitive creates images that bend around the user. Curved images arranged around the camera can be pleasing for legibility since each pixel sits at the same distance from the user. They can be a better choice than angled flat planes for complex layouts because they ensure a smooth surface rather than a series of awkward seams between planes.
description.text: The curved image primitive creates images that bend around the user. Curved images arranged around the camera can be pleasing for legibility since each pixel sits at the same distance from the user. They can be a better choice than angled flat planes for complex layouts because they ensure a smooth surface rather than a series of awkward seams between planes.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The cylinder primitive is used to create tubes and curved surfaces.
description.text: The cylinder primitive is used to create tubes and curved surfaces.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. This primitive creates a polyhedron with 12 faces
description.text: This primitive creates a polyhedron with 12 faces

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. Entities are placeholder objects to which we plug in components (aka HTML attributes) to provide them appearance, behavior, and functionality.
description.text: Entities are placeholder objects to which we plug in components (aka HTML attributes) to provide them appearance, behavior, and functionality.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. This primitive creates a polyhedron with 20 faces
description.text: This primitive creates a polyhedron with 20 faces

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The glTF model primitive displays a 3D glTF model created from a 3D modeling program or downloaded from the web.
description.text: The glTF model primitive displays a 3D glTF model created from a 3D modeling program or downloaded from the web.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The image primitive shows an image on a flat plane.
description.text: The image primitive shows an image on a flat plane.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. A light changes the lighting and shading of the scene.
description.text: A light changes the lighting and shading of the scene.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The link primitive provides a compact API to define links that resembles the traditional <a> tag.
description.text: The link primitive provides a compact API to define links that resembles the traditional <a> tag.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. It provides a way to compose and reuse commonly-used sets of component properties.
description.text: It provides a way to compose and reuse commonly-used sets of component properties.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. null
description.text: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. Make sure you've imported the library by including a <script> element for it.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The .OBJ model primitive displays a 3D Wavefront model.
description.text: The .OBJ model primitive displays a 3D Wavefront model.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. This primitive creates a polyhedron with 8 faces
description.text: This primitive creates a polyhedron with 8 faces

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The plane primitive creates flat surfaces using the geometry component with the type set to plane.
description.text: The plane primitive creates flat surfaces using the geometry component with the type set to plane.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. null
description.text: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. Make sure you've imported the library by including a <script> element for it.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The ring primitive creates a ring or disc shape.
description.text: The ring primitive creates a ring or disc shape.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The scene is the global root object, and all entities are contained within the scene.
description.text: The scene is the global root object, and all entities are contained within the scene.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. It adds a background color or 360° image to a scene. A sky is a large sphere with a color or texture mapped to the inside.
description.text: It adds a background color or 360° image to a scene. A sky is a large sphere with a color or texture mapped to the inside.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The sound primitive wraps the sound component.
description.text: The sound primitive wraps the sound component.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The sphere primitive creates a spherical or polyhedron shapes. It wraps an entity that prescribes the geometry component with its geometric primitive set to sphere.
description.text: The sphere primitive creates a spherical or polyhedron shapes. It wraps an entity that prescribes the geometry component with its geometric primitive set to sphere.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. This primitive creates a polyhedron composed of four triangular faces
description.text: This primitive creates a polyhedron composed of four triangular faces

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. Wraps the text component, which renders signed distance field (SDF) font text.
description.text: Wraps the text component, which renders signed distance field (SDF) font text.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The torus primitive creates donut or tube shapes using the geometry component with the type set to torus.
description.text: The torus primitive creates donut or tube shapes using the geometry component with the type set to torus.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The torus knot primitive creates pretzel shapes using the geometry component with the type set to torusKnot.
description.text: The torus knot primitive creates pretzel shapes using the geometry component with the type set to torusKnot.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The triangle primitive creates triangle surfaces using the geometry component with the type set to triangle.
description.text: The triangle primitive creates triangle surfaces using the geometry component with the type set to triangle.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. The video primitive plays a video as a texture on a flat plane.
description.text: The video primitive plays a video as a texture on a flat plane.

description.html: This HTML custom element is part of the A-Frame library. https://aframe.io/docs/1.0.0/primitives/a-videosphere.html#sidebar
description.text: https://aframe.io/docs/1.0.0/primitives/a-videosphere.html#sidebar

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It lets us animate and tween values including position, rotation and more.
description.text: It lets us animate and tween values including position, rotation and more.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It defines from which perspective the user views the scene. The camera is commonly paired with controls components that allow input devices to move and rotate the camera.
description.text: It defines from which perspective the user views the scene. The camera is commonly paired with controls components that allow input devices to move and rotate the camera.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The cursor component provides hover and click states for interaction on top of the raycaster component. The cursor component can be used for both gaze-based and controller-based interactions, but the appearance needs to be configured depending on the use case.
description.text: The cursor component provides hover and click states for interaction on top of the raycaster component. The cursor component can be used for both gaze-based and controller-based interactions, but the appearance needs to be configured depending on the use case.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The daydream-controls component interfaces with the Google Daydream controllers. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a Daydream controller model that highlights the touched and/or pressed buttons (trackpad).
description.text: The daydream-controls component interfaces with the Google Daydream controllers. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a Daydream controller model that highlights the touched and/or pressed buttons (trackpad).

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The gearvr-controls component interfaces with the Samsung/Oculus Gear VR controllers. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a Gear VR controller model that highlights the touched and/or pressed buttons (trackpad, trigger).
description.text: The gearvr-controls component interfaces with the Samsung/Oculus Gear VR controllers. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a Gear VR controller model that highlights the touched and/or pressed buttons (trackpad, trigger).

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The geometry component provides a basic shape for an entity. It's primitive property defines the general shape. Geometric "primitives", in computer graphics, are irreducible basic shapes. A material component is commonly defined to provide a appearance alongside the shape to create a complete mesh.
description.text: The geometry component provides a basic shape for an entity. It's primitive property defines the general shape. Geometric "primitives", in computer graphics, are irreducible basic shapes. A material component is commonly defined to provide a appearance alongside the shape to create a complete mesh.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The tracked-controls component is A-Frame’s base controller component that provides the foundation for all of A-Frame’s controller components.
description.text: The tracked-controls component is A-Frame’s base controller component that provides the foundation for all of A-Frame’s controller components.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It loads a 3D model and material using a glTF (.lgtf or .glb) file.
description.text: It loads a 3D model and material using a glTF (.lgtf or .glb) file.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The hand-controls component provides tracked hands (using a prescribed model) with animated gestures. hand-controls wraps the vive-controls and oculus-touch-controls which in turn wrap the tracked-controls component. By specifying just hand-controls, we have something that works well with both Vive and Rift. The component gives extra events and handles hand animations and poses.
description.text: The hand-controls component provides tracked hands (using a prescribed model) with animated gestures. hand-controls wraps the vive-controls and oculus-touch-controls which in turn wrap the tracked-controls component. By specifying just hand-controls, we have something that works well with both Vive and Rift. The component gives extra events and handles hand animations and poses.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The HTML id attribute is used to specify a unique id for an HTML element. In the context of an A-Frame they are often used to associate an entity with an asset. In regular HTML it's often used to apply CSS to an element.
description.text: The HTML id attribute is used to specify a unique id for an HTML element. In the context of an A-Frame they are often used to associate an entity with an asset. In regular HTML it's often used to apply CSS to an element.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The laser-controls component provides tracked controls with a laser or ray cursor shooting out to be used for input and interactions. DoF stands for degrees of freedom. Because they only require rotation and some form of input, laser-based interactions scale well across 0 DoF (gaze-based, Cardboard), 3 DoF (Daydream, GearVR with controllers), and 6 DoF (Vive, Oculus Touch). If desired, we can get a consistent form of interaction that works across all VR platforms with a single line of HTML.
description.text: The laser-controls component provides tracked controls with a laser or ray cursor shooting out to be used for input and interactions. DoF stands for degrees of freedom. Because they only require rotation and some form of input, laser-based interactions scale well across 0 DoF (gaze-based, Cardboard), 3 DoF (Daydream, GearVR with controllers), and 6 DoF (Vive, Oculus Touch). If desired, we can get a consistent form of interaction that works across all VR platforms with a single line of HTML.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The light component defines the entity as a source of light. Light affects all materials that have not specified a flat shading model with shader: flat. Note that lights are computationally expensive we should limit number of lights in a scene.
description.text: The light component defines the entity as a source of light. Light affects all materials that have not specified a flat shading model with shader: flat. Note that lights are computationally expensive we should limit number of lights in a scene.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The line component draws a line given a start coordinate and end coordinate using THREE.Line.
description.text: The line component draws a line given a start coordinate and end coordinate using THREE.Line.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The link component connects between experiences and allows for traversing between VR web pages. When activated via an event, the link component sends the user to a different page, just like a normal web page redirect.
description.text: The link component connects between experiences and allows for traversing between VR web pages. When activated via an event, the link component sends the user to a different page, just like a normal web page redirect.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The look-controls component: Rotates the entity when we rotate a VR head-mounted display (HMD). Rotates the entity when we move the mouse. Rotates the entity when we touch-drag the touchscreen.
description.text: The look-controls component: Rotates the entity when we rotate a VR head-mounted display (HMD). Rotates the entity when we move the mouse. Rotates the entity when we touch-drag the touchscreen.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The windows-motion-controls component interfaces with any spatial controllers exposed through Windows Mixed Reality as Spatial Input Sources (such as Motion Controllers). It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a controller model that highlights applies position/rotation transforms to the pressed buttons (trigger, grip, menu, thumbstick, trackpad) and moved axes (thumbstick and trackpad.)
description.text: The windows-motion-controls component interfaces with any spatial controllers exposed through Windows Mixed Reality as Spatial Input Sources (such as Motion Controllers). It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a controller model that highlights applies position/rotation transforms to the pressed buttons (trigger, grip, menu, thumbstick, trackpad) and moved axes (thumbstick and trackpad.)

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The material component gives appearance to an entity. We can define properties such as color, opacity, or texture. This is often paired with the geometry component which provides shape.
description.text: The material component gives appearance to an entity. We can define properties such as color, opacity, or texture. This is often paired with the geometry component which provides shape.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It provides a way to compose and reuse commonly-used sets of component properties.
description.text: It provides a way to compose and reuse commonly-used sets of component properties.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It loads a 3D model and material using a Wavefront (.OBJ) file and a .MTL file.
description.text: It loads a 3D model and material using a Wavefront (.OBJ) file and a .MTL file.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The oculus-go-controls component interfaces with the Oculus Go controllers. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and an Oculus Go controller model that highlights the touched and/or pressed buttons (trackpad, trigger).
description.text: The oculus-go-controls component interfaces with the Oculus Go controllers. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and an Oculus Go controller model that highlights the touched and/or pressed buttons (trackpad, trigger).

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The oculus-touch-controls component interfaces with the Oculus Touch controllers. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a Touch controller model.
description.text: The oculus-touch-controls component interfaces with the Oculus Touch controllers. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a Touch controller model.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It places entities at certain spots in 3D space. Position takes coordinate "x y z" values as three numbers separated by spaces.
description.text: It places entities at certain spots in 3D space. Position takes coordinate "x y z" values as three numbers separated by spaces.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The raycaster component provides line-based intersection testing with a raycaster. Raycasting is the method of extending a line from an origin towards a direction, and checking whether that line intersects with other entites.
description.text: The raycaster component provides line-based intersection testing with a raycaster. Raycasting is the method of extending a line from an origin towards a direction, and checking whether that line intersects with other entites.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It is used to configure the renderer settings (like anialias which when set to true smooths jagged edges on curved lines)
description.text: It is used to configure the renderer settings (like anialias which when set to true smooths jagged edges on curved lines)

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It defines the orientation of an entity in degrees. It takes the pitch (x), yaw (y), and roll (z) as three numbers separated by spaces.
description.text: It defines the orientation of an entity in degrees. It takes the pitch (x), yaw (y), and roll (z) as three numbers separated by spaces.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. It defines a shrinking, stretching, or skewing transformation of an entity. It takes three scaling factors for the "x y z" axes.
description.text: It defines a shrinking, stretching, or skewing transformation of an entity. It takes three scaling factors for the "x y z" axes.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The shadow component enables shadows for an entity and its children. Receiving shadows from surrounding objects and casting shadows onto other objects may (and often should) be enabled independently.
description.text: The shadow component enables shadows for an entity and its children. Receiving shadows from surrounding objects and casting shadows onto other objects may (and often should) be enabled independently.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The sound component defines the entity as a source of sound or audio. The sound component is positional and is thus affected by the components-position.
description.text: The sound component defines the entity as a source of sound or audio. The sound component is positional and is thus affected by the components-position.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The text component renders signed distance field (SDF) font text.
description.text: The text component renders signed distance field (SDF) font text.

elements.html: <a-assets>, <a-asset-item>, <a-box>, <a-camera>, <a-circle>, <a-cone>, <a-cubemap>, <a-cursor>, <a-curvedimage>, <a-cylinder>, <a-dodecahedron>, <a-entity>, <a-icosahedron>, <a-gltf-model>, <a-image>, <a-light>, <a-link>, <a-mixin>, <a-node>, <a-obj-model>, <a-octahedron>, <a-plane>, <a-register-element>, <a-ring>, <a-scene>, <a-sky>, <a-sound>, <a-sphere>, <a-tetrahedron>, <a-text>, <a-torus>, <a-torus-knot>, <a-triangle>, <a-video>, <a-videosphere>

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The tracked-controls component is A-Frame’s base controller component that provides the foundation for all of A-Frame’s controller components.
description.text: The tracked-controls component is A-Frame’s base controller component that provides the foundation for all of A-Frame’s controller components.

elements.html: <a-assets>, <a-asset-item>, <a-box>, <a-camera>, <a-circle>, <a-cone>, <a-cubemap>, <a-cursor>, <a-curvedimage>, <a-cylinder>, <a-dodecahedron>, <a-entity>, <a-icosahedron>, <a-gltf-model>, <a-image>, <a-light>, <a-link>, <a-mixin>, <a-node>, <a-obj-model>, <a-octahedron>, <a-plane>, <a-register-element>, <a-ring>, <a-scene>, <a-sky>, <a-sound>, <a-sphere>, <a-tetrahedron>, <a-text>, <a-torus>, <a-torus-knot>, <a-triangle>, <a-video>, <a-videosphere>

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The tracked-controls component interfaces with tracked controllers. tracked-controls uses the Gamepad API to handle tracked controllers, and is abstracted by the hand-controls component as well as the vive-controls, oculus-touch-controls, windows-motion-controls, and daydream-controls components. This component elects the appropriate controller, applies pose to the entity, observes buttons state and emits appropriate events. For non-6DOF controllers such as daydream-controls, a primitive arm model is used to emulate positional data.
description.text: The tracked-controls component interfaces with tracked controllers. tracked-controls uses the Gamepad API to handle tracked controllers, and is abstracted by the hand-controls component as well as the vive-controls, oculus-touch-controls, windows-motion-controls, and daydream-controls components. This component elects the appropriate controller, applies pose to the entity, observes buttons state and emits appropriate events. For non-6DOF controllers such as daydream-controls, a primitive arm model is used to emulate positional data.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The tracked-controls component interfaces with tracked controllers. tracked-controls uses the Gamepad API to handle tracked controllers, and is abstracted by the hand-controls component as well as the vive-controls, oculus-touch-controls, windows-motion-controls, and daydream-controls components. This component elects the appropriate controller, applies pose to the entity, observes buttons state and emits appropriate events. For non-6DOF controllers such as daydream-controls, a primitive arm model is used to emulate positional data.
description.text: The tracked-controls component interfaces with tracked controllers. tracked-controls uses the Gamepad API to handle tracked controllers, and is abstracted by the hand-controls component as well as the vive-controls, oculus-touch-controls, windows-motion-controls, and daydream-controls components. This component elects the appropriate controller, applies pose to the entity, observes buttons state and emits appropriate events. For non-6DOF controllers such as daydream-controls, a primitive arm model is used to emulate positional data.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The visible component determines whether to render an entity. If set to false, then the entity will not be visible nor drawn.
description.text: The visible component determines whether to render an entity. If set to false, then the entity will not be visible nor drawn.

elements.html: <a-assets>, <a-asset-item>, <a-box>, <a-camera>, <a-circle>, <a-cone>, <a-cubemap>, <a-cursor>, <a-curvedimage>, <a-cylinder>, <a-dodecahedron>, <a-entity>, <a-icosahedron>, <a-gltf-model>, <a-image>, <a-light>, <a-link>, <a-mixin>, <a-node>, <a-obj-model>, <a-octahedron>, <a-plane>, <a-register-element>, <a-ring>, <a-scene>, <a-sky>, <a-sound>, <a-sphere>, <a-tetrahedron>, <a-text>, <a-torus>, <a-torus-knot>, <a-triangle>, <a-video>, <a-videosphere>

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The vive-controls component interfaces with the HTC Vive controllers/wands. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a Vive controller model that highlights the pressed buttons (trigger, grip, menu, system) and trackpad.
description.text: The vive-controls component interfaces with the HTC Vive controllers/wands. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a Vive controller model that highlights the pressed buttons (trigger, grip, menu, system) and trackpad.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The vive-focus-controls component interfaces with the Vive Focus controller. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and an Vive Focus controller model that highlights the touched and/or pressed buttons (trackpad, trigger).
description.text: The vive-focus-controls component interfaces with the Vive Focus controller. It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and an Vive Focus controller model that highlights the touched and/or pressed buttons (trackpad, trigger).

elements.html: <a-assets>, <a-asset-item>, <a-box>, <a-camera>, <a-circle>, <a-cone>, <a-cubemap>, <a-cursor>, <a-curvedimage>, <a-cylinder>, <a-dodecahedron>, <a-entity>, <a-icosahedron>, <a-gltf-model>, <a-image>, <a-light>, <a-link>, <a-mixin>, <a-node>, <a-obj-model>, <a-octahedron>, <a-plane>, <a-register-element>, <a-ring>, <a-scene>, <a-sky>, <a-sound>, <a-sphere>, <a-tetrahedron>, <a-text>, <a-torus>, <a-torus-knot>, <a-triangle>, <a-video>, <a-videosphere>

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The wasd-controls component controls an entity with the WASD or arrow keyboard keys. The wasd-controls component is commonly attached to an entity with the camera component.
description.text: The wasd-controls component controls an entity with the WASD or arrow keyboard keys. The wasd-controls component is commonly attached to an entity with the camera component.

elements.html: <a-assets>, <a-asset-item>, <a-box>, <a-camera>, <a-circle>, <a-cone>, <a-cubemap>, <a-cursor>, <a-curvedimage>, <a-cylinder>, <a-dodecahedron>, <a-entity>, <a-icosahedron>, <a-gltf-model>, <a-image>, <a-light>, <a-link>, <a-mixin>, <a-node>, <a-obj-model>, <a-octahedron>, <a-plane>, <a-register-element>, <a-ring>, <a-scene>, <a-sky>, <a-sound>, <a-sphere>, <a-tetrahedron>, <a-text>, <a-torus>, <a-torus-knot>, <a-triangle>, <a-video>, <a-videosphere>

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The windows-motion-controls component interfaces with any spatial controllers exposed through Windows Mixed Reality as Spatial Input Sources (such as Motion Controllers). It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a controller model that highlights applies position/rotation transforms to the pressed buttons (trigger, grip, menu, thumbstick, trackpad) and moved axes (thumbstick and trackpad.)
description.text: The windows-motion-controls component interfaces with any spatial controllers exposed through Windows Mixed Reality as Spatial Input Sources (such as Motion Controllers). It wraps the tracked-controls component while adding button mappings, events, and a controller model that highlights applies position/rotation transforms to the pressed buttons (trigger, grip, menu, thumbstick, trackpad) and moved axes (thumbstick and trackpad.)

elements.html: <a-assets>, <a-asset-item>, <a-box>, <a-camera>, <a-circle>, <a-cone>, <a-cubemap>, <a-cursor>, <a-curvedimage>, <a-cylinder>, <a-dodecahedron>, <a-entity>, <a-icosahedron>, <a-gltf-model>, <a-image>, <a-light>, <a-link>, <a-mixin>, <a-node>, <a-obj-model>, <a-octahedron>, <a-plane>, <a-register-element>, <a-ring>, <a-scene>, <a-sky>, <a-sound>, <a-sphere>, <a-tetrahedron>, <a-text>, <a-torus>, <a-torus-knot>, <a-triangle>, <a-video>, <a-videosphere>

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The background component sets a basic color background of a scene that is more performant than a-sky since geometry is not created. There are no undesired frustum culling issues when a-sky is further than the far plane of the camera. There are no unexpected occlusions either with far objects that might be behind of the sphere geometry of a-sky.
description.text: The background component sets a basic color background of a scene that is more performant than a-sky since geometry is not created. There are no undesired frustum culling issues when a-sky is further than the far plane of the camera. There are no unexpected occlusions either with far objects that might be behind of the sphere geometry of a-sky.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The debug component enables component-to-DOM serialization.
description.text: The debug component enables component-to-DOM serialization.

elements.html: <a-assets>, <a-asset-item>, <a-box>, <a-camera>, <a-circle>, <a-cone>, <a-cubemap>, <a-cursor>, <a-curvedimage>, <a-cylinder>, <a-dodecahedron>, <a-entity>, <a-icosahedron>, <a-gltf-model>, <a-image>, <a-light>, <a-link>, <a-mixin>, <a-node>, <a-obj-model>, <a-octahedron>, <a-plane>, <a-register-element>, <a-ring>, <a-scene>, <a-sky>, <a-sound>, <a-sphere>, <a-tetrahedron>, <a-text>, <a-torus>, <a-torus-knot>, <a-triangle>, <a-video>, <a-videosphere>

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. Starting with Safari on iOS 13 browsers require sites to be served over https and request user permission to access DeviceOrientation events. This component presents a permission dialog for the user to grant or deny access.
description.text: Starting with Safari on iOS 13 browsers require sites to be served over https and request user permission to access DeviceOrientation events. This component presents a permission dialog for the user to grant or deny access.

elements.html: <a-assets>, <a-asset-item>, <a-box>, <a-camera>, <a-circle>, <a-cone>, <a-cubemap>, <a-cursor>, <a-curvedimage>, <a-cylinder>, <a-dodecahedron>, <a-entity>, <a-icosahedron>, <a-gltf-model>, <a-image>, <a-light>, <a-link>, <a-mixin>, <a-node>, <a-obj-model>, <a-octahedron>, <a-plane>, <a-register-element>, <a-ring>, <a-scene>, <a-sky>, <a-sound>, <a-sphere>, <a-tetrahedron>, <a-text>, <a-torus>, <a-torus-knot>, <a-triangle>, <a-video>, <a-videosphere>

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The embedded component removes fullscreen CSS styles from A-Frame’s element, making it easier to embed within the layout of an existing webpage. Embedding removes the default fixed positioning from the canvas and makes the Enter VR button smaller.
description.text: The embedded component removes fullscreen CSS styles from A-Frame’s <canvas> element, making it easier to embed within the layout of an existing webpage. Embedding removes the default fixed positioning from the canvas and makes the Enter VR button smaller.

description.html: This special attribute (also known as a "component" in this case) is part of the A-Frame library. The pool component allows for object pooling. This gives us a reusable pool of entities to avoid creating and destroying the same kind of entities in dynamic scenes. Object pooling helps reduce garbage collection pauses.
description.text: The pool component allows for object pooling. This gives us a reusable pool of entities to avoid creating and destroying the same kind of entities in dynamic scenes. Object pooling helps reduce garbage collection pauses.
